results.title: Brad
results.creator_credit: Tom Manefield, Phil Noyce and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Growing Up”.
Brad identifies himself as a homosexual. The film examines his reactions to homosexuality and the importance of relationships with other males. His mother expresses her feelings about Brad’s sexuality; he is shown in his employment and enjoying himself socially.

results.title: Brabazon: king of the air
results.brief_description: A report on the building of the giant, eight-engine Brabazon air liner, from its conception as an idea to the time of its flight in Septpember 1949. Commentary by John Mills.

results.title: Boyz'n the hood
results.creator_credit: Steve Nicolaides, Columbia Pictures and John Singleton
results.brief_description: In the 1980s, spurned on by the success of Spike Lee, young Afro-American directors began to develop scripts and films for the mainstream American movie industry. Previously, black filmmakers in the United States had to work completely outside the system or in the exploitation genres if they wished to work with black actors and black themes. John Singleton’s “Boyz ‘n the Hood” was one of the pioneering works of this new Hollywood cinema. Cuba Gooding Jr. plays a young man who has grown up in the severely economically deprived inner-city ghetto of South Central Los Angeles. He has to decide whether to follow his friends into a life of gang criminality and drug use or whether to leave behind the “hood” and pursue an academic career as his embittered former activist father wants him to (Larry Fishburne). Refusing the exploitative excesses that dehumanise African-American ghetto characters in most action films, “Boyz n’ the Hood” reveals the complexity of growing up in a segregated world in which entrenched unemployment has meant that for young men, only the drug economy provides any chance for success or wealth. Cast also includes Ice Cube.

results.title: Boys will be men
results.creator_credit: ONF | NFB, Edward Le Lorrain, Margaret Pettigrew and Don Rennick
results.brief_description: This film takes a candid, inside look at the world of juvenile delinquency and we are shown the tough existence on the streets of North American cities. In the film, boys, some as young as ten years of age, talk about their lives of crime, the things that are important to them and the hopes they hold for the future.

results.title: Boys will be boys (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: John Dovey, Open Channel Productions, Equal Opportunity Resource Unit and Roger Selleck
results.brief_description: Examines the attitudes of teenage boys to teenage girls, their peers and their parents. Three segments are dramatised and then discussed by the participants highlighting the conflicts and dynamics of each situation.

results.title: Boys will be boys
results.creator_credit: John Dovey, Open Channel Productions and Roger Selleck
results.brief_description: A discussion film about masculinity , communication and feelings, this video uses role plays to explore male sexuality, focussing on “mateship”, relationships, boys in the home environment and their behaviour towards girls. A number of short scenes are dramatised, and these are followed by a short discussion about issues raised by the dramas.

results.title: Boys Town
results.creator_credit: John W. Considine, Metro-Goldwyn-Mayer, Loews Inc and Norman Taurog
results.brief_description: The moving story of Father Flanagan (Spencer Tracy) who battled the courts, the community but mostly the odds to build Boys Town in Nebraska, a home for abandoned, homeless boys, regardless of race, creed or colour. When the tough, rebellious Whitey March (Mickey Rooney) arrives, Father Flanagan faces the challenge of his life. He must fight not only to save the self-destructive youth, but to save Boys Town itself. Spencer Tracy won his second Academy Award for his performance and Mickey Rooney excels as Whitey, proving his strength as a talented dramatic actor. Eleanore Griffin and Dore Schary also earned Oscars for their original story. Co-starring Henry Hull, Leslie Fenton and Gene Reynolds. “Boys Town” will steal your heart and leave you with something even better - inspiration.

results.title: Boys on the side
results.creator_credit: Studio Canal+, Regency Enterprises, Alcor Films, New Regency Pictures, Heva Productions, Monarchy Enterprises B. V., Arnon Mitchell, Steven Reuther, Herbert Ross and Ken Adam
results.brief_description: Three women share a car going West and laughs, tears and togetherness unfold along the way. They each have secrets to reveal, strengths to impart and vital moments of self discovery; and their shared friendship subsequently becomes family. Whoopi Goldberg (a wisecracking, lesbian club singer), Mary Louise Parker (a finicky HIV+ real-estate agent) and Drew Barrymore (a free spirit) join forces in this celebration of camaraderie, the art of survival, the gift of laughter and the miracle of friendship and caring by Herbert Ross, the director of The Turning Point and Steel Magnolias. Co-starring Matthew McConaughey, James Remar, Billy Wirth, Anita Gillette, Dennis Boutsikaris, Amy Acquino, Stan Egi and Estelle Parsons.
